usa: The Hay–Herrán Treaty was passed.<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference">[8]</sup>
The Ford Motor Company was formed.<sup id="cite_ref-FordTimeline_9-0" class="reference">[9]</sup>
The Department of Commerce and Labor was created.<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference">[10]</sup>
The first World Series was played between the Boston Americans and Pittsburgh Pirates.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference">[11]</sup>
The Hay–Bunau-Varilla Treaty was signed.<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference">[12]</sup>
The movie The Great Train Robbery premieres.[13]
The Wright brothers made their first powered flight in the Wright Flyer.[14]
australia: The High Court of Australia is established with Samuel Griffith as the first Chief Justice.
The Defence Act gives the federal government full control over the Australian Army
Australian federal election, 1903: Alfred Deakin is elected as the 2nd Prime Minister of Australia.
